alert.note: Alert for Little River; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 12:34PM CDT until July 16 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Sevier County in southwestern Arkansas... Western Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Southern McCurtain County in southeastern Oklahoma... Western Marion County in northeastern Texas... Franklin County in northeastern Texas... Northwestern Rusk County in northeastern Texas... Western Bowie County in northeastern Texas... Upshur County in northeastern Texas... Titus County in northeastern Texas... Central Smith County in northeastern Texas... Western Cass County in northeastern Texas... Northwestern Harrison County in northeastern Texas... Wood County in northeastern Texas... Morris County in northeastern Texas... Camp County in northeastern Texas... Gregg County in northeastern Texas... Red River County in northeastern Texas... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1233 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Manchester to near Mount Pleasant to near Hawkins, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Tyler, Longview, Mount Pleasant, Kilgore, White Oak, Gladewater, Gilmer, New Boston, Mineola, Pittsburg, Winnsboro, Clarksville, Foreman, Boxelder, Hagansport, Leesburg, Idabel, Lindale, Hallsville and Mount Vernon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
